availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's Official Correspondence File, 1863-1867

body.p:
Head-Quarters District of Kentucky and
1ST DIVISION, 23D ARMY CORPS,
Louisville, Nov 28th 1863.

The Cashier of the Bank of Kentucky at Mt Sterling will pay to Hon Thos. E. Bramlette Gov of Ky or order, any monies deposited in said bank by Capt Williams late Provost Marshal of Mt Sterling to my credit.
Bank of Kentucky will have the amount embraced on the foregoing order transfered to my credit at Frankfort
Pay J B Temple @ an order for collection

J B Temple
Put on Stamp
Cash of Mt Sterling Branch returns this check says "no funds" "They told me at Barnes White & Co that Capt Williams had a special deposit there but had not authorized them to pay it out to any one"
J B Temple no other Bank at Mt Sterling
